H0.text: Ephedra is the plant genus whose leaves are the source of the compound ephedrine, which is used in medicine as a potent decongestant and is similar to amphetamines.

H1.text: Stimulant is the leaves of the plant genus Ephedra, which are the source of the compound ephedrine used in medicine as a potent decongestant and are similar to amphetamines.

H2.text: Dietary are the leaves of what plant genus are the source of the compound ephedrine, which is used in medicine as a potent decongestant and is similar to amphetamines.

H3.text: Additive is the plant genus whose leaves are the source of the compound ephedrine, which is used in medicine as a potent decongestant and is similar to amphetamines.

A4.text: Ephedra (medicine) is a medicinal preparation from the plant Ephedra sinica.

A5.text: Ephedra (plant) is a genus of gymnosperm shrubs.
